column4: hello! after a recent update, i lost use of my center mouse wheel. anything i can do to fix this? thanks!
do you recall any of the updates?
I assume you already rebooted to see if it persists?
where it is plugged in is the plug round or flat?
ok ...by chance are you dual booted with windows?
what I mean is ..do you also have windows installed on that same machine?
oh :) ok  the reason I asked is to rule out  hardware issue
ok  open a terminal  and type   xinput list
look for your mouse id there
did you find the mouse id?
ok now in  that same terminal type  xinput test  id=whatever the id is  then press the middle mouse button
ok it might be a hardware issue then...try one of the other ids as well for left click and right click test
do you have another mouse you can test with?
ok ... well... the first thing to test here is if it is indeed the hardware... it just may be a coincidence that after the updates the mouse decided to die
but that has to be tested first,,, to be sure
the thing that puzzles me is the "Virtual core pointer" listing there
did you try unplugging the mouse and putting it into another usb port?

ah  wait... on my xinput list there is also a virtual core xtest pointer however,  below that is the mouse name so apparenlty the system is not seeing the mouse properly ...change the usb port if possible  or just unplug then replug the mouse back in ...run xinput list again
